intro: Ecbolium viride var. laetevirens, commonly known as the green ecbolium, is a rare variant of the ecbolium plant characterized by its vivid green foliage. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
